sorular.soru: Can the police take your driving licence if you have seriously endangered road safety?

feedback.metin: If you have seriously endangered road safety and are pulled over, the police must confiscate your driving licence. Your driving licence will be sent to the public prosecutor's office together with the official report. The public prosecutor will then decide on further action.

sorular.soru: What should you do here?

feedback.metin: When turning, you must give way to traffic going straight ahead on the same road. These are not only drivers, but also pedestrians. You have too little space to pass neatly in front of cyclists.

sorular.soru: Can you drive onto this road to deliver something to a resident?

feedback.metin: The upper sign indicates that the road is closed to all motor vehicles. The bottom sign indicates that the sign above it does not apply to destination traffic. However, you may drive on this road if your destination is here, for example if you are visiting someone or delivering something.

sorular.soru: Is this allowed?

feedback.metin: Parking or stopping on cycle lanes or on the road next to cycle lanes is prohibited.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with this load that protrudes 15 cm from the sides?
cevaplar: Yes. But only if the load is marked.

feedback.metin: Cargo on the roof of a vehicle may stick out a maximum of 20 centimetres on either side. It does not need to be marked. If the load on a trailer protrudes more than 10 cm from the sides, it must be marked. This rule does not apply to passenger cars.

sorular.soru: Can you ride a bicycle if you are disqualified from driving?

feedback.metin: If you are disqualified from driving, you are no longer allowed to drive any motor vehicle. However, you may ride a bicycle. Taking driving lessons while disqualified is prohibited. A driving disqualification is not the same as a driving ban. In the event of a driving ban, you are no longer allowed to drive any vehicle. So with a driving ban, you are no longer allowed to ride a bicycle.

sorular.soru: Will the motorway you are on continue with two lanes?

feedback.metin: The motorway you are driving on will continue with three lanes instead of two. The L-101 sign indicates that two carriageways – each with two lanes – will merge to become one carriageway with three lanes. The left lane on the right carriageway will merge directly with the right lane of the left carriageway.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light comes on?
cevaplar: Stop immediately and check the oil level.
Stop immediately and check the coolant level.
Keep driving and refill the windscreen washer fluid at home.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop immediately and check the coolant level.

feedback.metin: This light warns of excessive engine temperature. This means that there is something wrong with the engine's cooling system. Move the vehicle directly to the side of the road and check the coolant level. Never check the coolant level as long as the engine is still hot, but wait for it to cool down. Hot coolant can cause severe burns. Call the breakdown service if necessary, for instance when you are standing on the hard shoulder or when you suspect leakage.

sorular.soru: Are you positioned properly?

feedback.metin: You must give way to the bus which is approaching from the right. However, he cannot turn left because of the length of the vehicle. You should have stopped earlier so that the bus could turn to the left.

sorular.soru: What traffic behaviour is expected of you here?
cevaplar: You must brake and swerve into the verge.
You must maintain the same speed.
You must drive on the left lane.
sorular.dogruCevap: You must maintain the same speed.

feedback.metin: To best assist the police car behind you, drive predictably and follow the rules of traffic. Do not brake or swerve.

sorular.soru: You do not want to get in lane, but want to follow the weaving lane. When do you indicate your direction of travel?
cevaplar: Just before the weaving lane and the main carriageway join together.
Just before the first arrow on the road surface of the weaving lane.
You do not indicate direction, you only do that if you want to get in lane.
sorular.dogruCevap: Just before the weaving lane and the main carriageway join together.

feedback.metin: A weaving lane is a combined acceleration and deceleration lane. If you approach a road via this weaving lane and you do not want to get in lane, you turn on your indicator to the right. You especially do this if the weaving lane and the  main carriageway join together. This way traffic on the main carriageway knows you do not want to get in lane.

sorular.soru: Which manner of pre-sorting is allowed?

feedback.metin: Pre-sorting is only allowed as in situation B. You are only allowed to pre-sort on a cycle lane with a broken line. A cycle lane with a solid line may only be used by cyclists, snorfietsers and drivers of disabled vehicles.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive on?
cevaplar: No. You cannot drive on yet.
Yes. But you are only allowed to drive straight on.
Yes. But you can only turn right.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. You cannot drive on yet.

feedback.metin: The traffic controller is giving a stop sign for traffic approaching from behind, which means you have to stop here.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to use your mobile phone to navigate on the road?

feedback.metin: You can use your phone to navigate while driving, as long as you are not holding the phone. Holding a mobile phone while driving is prohibited. This unnecessarily endangers other road users. This applies to anything one would hold a phone for, such as changing music, checking traffic updates, adjusting navigation, making or receiving calls, and sending or receiving text messages.

sorular.soru: What is the correct way to wear a seat belt over the body?
cevaplar: Tighten the belt until there is no more slack.
Tighten the belt as loosely as possible.
Fasten the belt as tightly as possible.
sorular.dogruCevap: Tighten the belt until there is no more slack.

feedback.metin: Pull the belt until there is no slack between the belt and the body. A belt that is too loose is unsafe and a belt that is too tight is uncomfortable.

sorular.soru: What speed difference should you take into account?

feedback.metin: A moped may ride on the carriageway at a maximum allowed speed of 45 km/h.  As the driver of a passenger car, you can drive at a maximum of 50 km/h in built-up areas. The difference in the speed you have to take into account is therefore 5 km/h.

sorular.soru: The barriers are going up again. Are you allowed to continue driving?
cevaplar: Yes. Unless the bells begin to ring again.
No. You must wait until the red light has gone out.
No. You must wait until the barriers are fully up.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. You must wait until the red light has gone out.

feedback.metin: You may only cross a level crossing once the red light has gone out. Even if the barriers are already going up, a train may pass on the other side.

sorular.soru: Who should you give way to here?

feedback.metin: The entrance and exit of this erf is an entrance/exit construction. You must give way to all road users when using an entrance or exit, including pedestrians.

sorular.soru: Can you drop off a passenger here?

feedback.metin: Parking or waiting on the blocked or checkered markings at a bus stop is prohibited. If there are no blocked markings, parking or waiting within 12 metres of the stop sign is prohibited. The only exception to this rule is if you are picking up or dropping off a passenger. This is allowed, even in the presence of blocked markings.

sorular.soru: When does a trailer have to be fitted with side marker lights?
cevaplar: If it is higher than 3.65 metres.
If it is longer than 6.00 metres.
If it is wider than 2.10 metres.
sorular.dogruCevap: If it is longer than 6.00 metres.

feedback.metin: If a trailer or caravan is longer than 6 metres, it must be fitted with amber side markings. The rear marking light may be red.

sorular.soru: After an accident, a victim lies unconscious on the ground but is breathing. What should you do?
cevaplar: Do nothing and do not move the person.
Place the person in a stable lateral position.
Place the person on their back.
sorular.dogruCevap: Place the person in a stable lateral position.

feedback.metin: Stable lateral position is a First Aid technique used for unconscious and vomiting victims who are still breathing. Every unconscious victim's airway is endangered because the tongue can sink into the pharynx.

sorular.soru: What special rule applies to pedestrians in an erf?
cevaplar: Pedestrians can use the whole road.
Pedestrians have right of way over all other road users.
Drivers must give way to pedestrians.
sorular.dogruCevap: Pedestrians can use the whole road.

feedback.metin: In an erf, almost all rules are the same as outside an erf. Within an erf, pedestrians are allowed to use the full width of the road. Therefore, there are no pavements. In addition, there is a speed limit for drivers of 15 km/h and parking is only allowed in the designated areas. The priority rules within an erf are the same as those outside.

sorular.soru: Does this parking ban apply on 5 October?

feedback.metin: The E-1 sign means: No parking on the side of the road where the sign is placed. The supplementary plate indicates the period that the parking ban applies. Here the supplementary plate indicates that the parking ban applies from the 16th to the 31st of each month. From the 1st to the 15th of each month you are allowed to park here.

sorular.soru: When should you maintain an increased following distance?
cevaplar: In a car without an anti-lock braking system (ABS).
During bad road or weather conditions.
If you are driving behind a brommobiel.
sorular.dogruCevap: During bad road or weather conditions.

feedback.metin: In optimal conditions, keep a two-second time gap to the vehicle in front. The distance the vehicle in front of you drives in two seconds, is the distance you should maintain. During bad road or weather conditions, keep a larger time gap.

sorular.soru: Can you drive with a copy of your driving licence?

feedback.metin: You must always be able to show an original and undamaged driving licence.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake with a trailer?

feedback.metin: Here, overtaking is prohibited for lorries. This sign does not apply to passenger cars with trailers. You are allowed to overtake. Keep in mind that you are not as fast with accelerating and that you have to pass the vehicle completely before moving to the right again. You need a lot more space to overtake than a car without a trailer. So, it is not always wise to overtake when pulling a trailer behind your car.

sorular.soru: Can you turn on your hazard lights if you suddenly arrive at a traffic jam with stationary or slow-moving traffic?

feedback.metin: When you unexpectedly come across a traffic jam with stationary or slow-moving traffic, it is best to warn traffic behind you with your hazard lights. When you observe traffic behind you also using hazard lights, you can turn yours off.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive like this?

feedback.metin: If your exhaust is broken, you are not allowed to drive the vehicle. A broken exhaust will produce a lot of unnecessary noise and parts of your exhaust may end up on the road. Moreover, an array of dangerous gases can be released. Always make sure you have a well-maintained vehicle.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit on a normal road outside built-up areas?

feedback.metin: The speed limit on roads outside built-up areas is 80 km/h. On rural roads, there is often a reduced speed limit of 60 km/h. This is indicated by signs. Autoweg and motorway speed limits are also indicated by signs. On autowegen, the speed limit is 100 km/h and on motorways 130 km/h, unless signage indicates otherwise.

sorular.soru: Can the pedestrian go first?

feedback.metin: You must give way to pedestrians and disabled vehicles who are crossing or about to cross a pedestrian crossing. Moreover, you must reduce your speed in time so that the pedestrian knows you have seen them.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to flash your headlights here?

feedback.metin: You may only use sound and optical signals to prevent imminent danger. This is not an emergency situation, so you have to wait for the driver to move to the right.

sorular.soru: Which situation depicts a driver?

feedback.metin: In situation B, this person is a driver, and in situation A, a pedestrian. Persons who move using a disabled vehicle fall under the category of drivers as soon as they use the carriageway, the cycle path, or the cycle/moped path. If they use the pavement or footpath or cross from one pavement or footpath to another, they fall under the category of pedestrians.

sorular.soru: In what situation is the lorry allowed to go first?

feedback.metin: The stop sign indicates that you must stop and give way to drivers from left and right. The lorry is approaching you. In this case, the driver turning right has priority over the driver turning left. In situation A, the lorry is turning right and you are turning left. In that case, you have to let the lorry go first. In situation B, you are turning right and the lorry must wait for you.

sorular.soru: Should you let the oncoming driver pass?

feedback.metin: There is a broken-down van on the left side of the carriageway. The oncoming driver must make an important lateral movement to be able to pass this. In doing so, the driver must give way to all other traffic. You may therefore go first and do not have to wait for this driver.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit for a moped rider on a cycle/moped path in built-up areas?

feedback.metin: A moped rider may not drive faster than 30 km/h on a cycle/moped path in built-up areas. On a cycle/moped path outside built-up areas, the speed limit is 40 km/h and on the road, it is 45 km/h.

sorular.soru: What is the risk if you overtake here?
cevaplar: That you will slip because it is usually more slippery in front of the gritter.
That the driver will not see you because of the blind spot.
That you will not be able to see anything through the brine scattered on your windscreen.
sorular.dogruCevap: That you will not be able to see anything through the brine scattered on your windscreen.

feedback.metin: Overtaking a gritter can be unwise as sprinkled brine may end up on your windscreen and temporarily block your vision. The belief that the road in front of the gritter is more slippery than behind it is incorrect. The gritted brine only works after it has been driven over and only after some time.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with a trailer with a maximum authorised mass of 750 kg with just a B driving licence?

feedback.metin: With a B driving licence, you may drive a vehicle with a trailer whereby the maximum authorised mass of the trailer does not exceed 750 kg. If the maximum authorised mass is more than 750 kg, you may also drive with a B driving licence, as long as the maximum authorised mass of the vehicle and the trailer together does not exceed 3500 kg. If it does exceed 3500 kg, you need an additional E driving licence.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake the tractor?
cevaplar: Yes. You are allowed to overtake agricultural vehicles here.
Yes. Because there is a broken line.
No. You are not allowed to overtake motor vehicles here.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. You are not allowed to overtake motor vehicles here.

feedback.metin: The F-1 sign indicates that motor vehicles may not overtake each other. A tractor is a motor vehicle; therefore you may not overtake it.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit here at 7.30 PM?

feedback.metin: On this motorway you are allowed to drive at 100 km/h between 6 AM and 7 PM. Outside these hours you can drive at 130 km/h. At 7.30 PM you can drive at 130 km/h here.

sorular.soru: What is the purpose of a valve cap?
cevaplar: To prevent dirt in the valve.
To keep the air in the tyre.
sorular.dogruCevap: To prevent dirt in the valve.

feedback.metin: A valve cap prevents dirt from entering the valve. The valve itself holds the air in the tyre. Always make sure that caps are placed securely on valves. The valves could otherwise get damaged.
